CatDescriptText: Cutline of images published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 7, 1940 reads: "Mess Time At Fort Bragg Is One Of The Biggest Events Of The Day - An Army Must Eat And These Chefs Handle The Job - Part of the responsibility of feeding the 3,000 Negro soldiers at Fort Bragg falls upon the men pictured above... At the right is Mess Sergeant Lewis of the 76th, waiting for the mid-day rush... - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Three men, including Mess Sergeant Lewis in center, standing in military mess kitchen at Fort Bragg, North Carolina
CatSubject_tab: Men--North Carolina--Fort Bragg.Kitchens--North Carolina--Fort Bragg.Fort Bragg (N.C.)
